Back to basics: Points maintenance
的 Trevor Bradbeer 有 B 4 ) F
In this article, which continues the Back-to-basics required; in the UK this is usually undertaken by Electrification
series on points (see February and March 2022 editions & Plant (E&P) personnel, and is outside the scope of this article.
of IRSE News), we will be considering three general and Ultimately the purpose of all maintenance is to ensure the
related subject areas: scheduled maintenance; fault- asset is presentable, operating safely, within acceptable
finding; and how Remote Condition Monitoring (RCM) (preferably optimal) parameters, and is able to do so for as long
can assist with both of these. Initially we will consider as possible. Maintenance activities can therefore be divided
faulting and maintenance in the more traditional sense along these lines: safety; performance; and life (prolonging)
BC (Before Condition monitoring!), and then move on - with a number of them falling into more than one category.
to AD (Assisted Digitally!). Maintenance can also be divided into preventive maintenance
and corrective maintenance.

Timely and effective maintenance of the point . .
actuating mechanism and the Switch and Crossing Scheduled (preventive) maintenance
(S&C) is essential for the safe operation of the railway. For reasons stated previously, scheduled maintenance is

covering the point actuating, lock and detection mechanism. Scheduled maintenance intervals

Points and crossings are an essential part of the railway infrastructure, and their effective
maintenance is critically important. Their location often poses challenges in carrying out this
work safely and without disrupting service.
servicing might be performed more frequently for ‘key points’ Permanent Way maintenance
whose operation is in high demand and therefore essential Before attempting to check the correct operation of the
for many train movements, such as ata Junction where two points operating mechanism it is necessary to ensure that the
busy routes converge. Failure of these key points would incur trackwork S&C is in good working order; there is no sense
high train delay penalties and/or damage the reputation of the and indeed some danger in adjusting the point operating
train operator. mechanism to compensate for an S&C problem.
In addition to this, a more detailed maintenance activity IS First and foremost, it is essential that the track gauge at the
undertaken less frequently, typically annually. This includes points is correctly maintained throughout the whole length of
further tests and checks on components that are not expected the points at all times. If the rails are out of gauge anywhere
to deteriorate quickly, for which an annual check is sufficient. in the S&C, temporary measures might be implemented, such
Maintenance standards as using packing pieces, to restore the correct dimension.
. However, a permanent fix, such as overhaul and renewal of
The maintenance standards adopted by a particular components, should be arranged as soon as possible.

Instructions directly, once approved by the relevant authority, (‘shoes’). Chair bolts, rail fastenings and stretcher bars must all
's a potentially easier and more direct approach, whereas be examined and tightened, adjusted or replaced as necessary.
standards produced by the infrastructure owner will have the Wooden sleepers in particular should be checked for signs of

owner that the manufacturer might not include.

where it might interfere with the operation of the points. Signalling maintenance personnel need to pay attention to

confidence in the RCM system. Some companies have
developed machine learning algorithms to help distinguish
